In Poland, Donald Tusk's anti-populist 'revolution' fails
subhead: Two years after coming to power, the democratic coalition led by the prime minister is at a standstill. The specter of a return to power by the nationalist Law and Justice party, supported by an even more extreme right, has never before loomed so large.

title: Regional leader in Spain steps down one year after deadly floods
subhead: Valencia region President Carlos Mazon faced criticism for his handling of the disaster and was subjected to repeated insults during the memorial ceremony for the victims on Wednesday.

title: China welcomes back the NBA, America's softpower heavyweight
subhead: Amid trade tensions between Washington and Beijing, the American basketball league continues to expand its roots in China, despite recurring diplomatic setbacks.

title: Charles Coste, world's oldest living Olympic champion, dies at 101
subhead: The former French cyclist, a gold medalist in the team pursuit at the 1948 London Games, carried the Olympic flame during the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Games. He died on Thursday at the age of 101.

The Orient Express pulls up in Paris: An opulent journey into the 1920s
subhead: The legendary luxury train is making a stop at Paris's Musée des Arts Décoratifs until spring. As part of the major exhibition dedicated to the centenary of Art Deco, three life-size mock-ups of the new Orient Express, set to return to service soon, are on display.

title: France's new 'unproductive wealth' tax reflects a limited adjustment
subhead: MPs approved on Friday a modification of the real estate wealth tax. Its base was broadened, but the tax rate was reduced by a third for the very wealthy. Its yield remains unclear.

title: At the Musée Picasso, Philip Guston and the irony of history
subhead: The American painter, a major figure of the second half of the 20th century who moved from figurative art to abstract expressionism, blended biting irony with a critique of American society.
